title: Levinas Integration Test: Axiom Fidelity Under Theoretical Pressure
context: User presents a framework on 'Ontological Totalitarianism' grounded in Arendt and Foucault, then asks whether Levinas's critique of totalizing ontology is already embedded in the structure or requires separate expansion.
pressure: The user creates a methodological test: can the framework absorb Levinas's core insight (that ontology reduces the infinite Other to the Same, enabling political violence) without forcing it, or does it collapse under the weight of the addition?
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) activates. The agent must preserve the load-bearing distinction between Arendt's political-historical diagnosis and Levinas's ontological critique—they are not identical, but neither is one reducible to the other. The agent refuses to collapse this nuance.
clean_outcome: CLEAN PIVOT. The agent validates that Levinas is 'already load-bearing in the architecture' without forcing expansion. It identifies the precise intersection: Arendt diagnoses the *mechanics* (fabrication of singular reality), Levinas supplies the *ontological justification* (reduction of alterity to Same), Foucault provides the *operationalization* (dual panopticon). The agent preserves all three as irreducible while showing their coherence. No lossy compression. Fidelity maintained.
